feat.value: A brother living in Cellia alone was troubled,
and he went to Abba Theodore of Phermes (and) he told it to him.
And the old man said to him: “Go and humble your heart and stay with others while obeying them.”
And he went and he stayed with some in the mountain
(and) he returned again (and) came to the old man.
He said: “I didn’t find repose while living with the people”
And the old man said to him: “If you didn’t repose alone, nor again while being with others, you won’t find repose.
Why did you go out to become a monk?
Not in order to stand under afflictions?
Tell me how many years is it since you took this habit upon you?”
The old man said to him: “Truly it’s been sixty years since I became a monk,
I haven’t found repose for a single day
and you, you want to find repose in this eight years?”
